frame.name: Offenses
frame.definition:
<def-root>Words in this frame describe acts in violation of a legal code.
<ex><fex name="Perpetrator">He</fex> was accused of <t><fex name="Offense">hijacking</fex></t> <fex name="Victim">a tour bus full of people</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE broadly picks out the degree of offense. <ex>She faces conviction on three counts of <fex name="Degree">first-degree</fex> <fex name="Off"><t>murder</t></fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Degree">Aggravated</fex> <fex name="Off"><t>assault</t></fex> is usually considered a felony.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Specification
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Specification</fen> is an additional aspect of the main crime being commited. <ex>He was charged with <fex name="Off"><t>assault</t></fex> <fex name="Spec">causing actual bodily harm</fex>.</ex> <ex>The prosecutors decided to go with <fex name="Off"><t>arson</t></fex> <fex name="Spec">with intent to harm</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Victim
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes the person or entity that is badly affected by the <fen>Offense</fen>. <ex>The police is investigating the <t>homicide</t> <fex name="Victim">of Dr. Johnson</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Punishment
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes the <fen>Punishment</fen> that is specified by the statute in which the offense is defined. <ex>Suicide is a <fex name="Offense">felony</fex> <fex name="Punishment">punishable by four years in prison</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: assault.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an act that threatens physical harm to a person, whether or not actual harm is done.

lexUnit.name: murder.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the unlawful killing of one person by another

lexUnit.name: statutory rape.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: sexual intercourse with a person younger than an age specified by statute.

lexUnit.name: sabotage.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of deliberately destroying property or hindering of normal operations (of an employer's business)

lexUnit.name: manslaughter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the crime of killing a human being without malice aforethought, or otherwise in circumstances not amounting to murder

lexUnit.name: hijacking.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the unlawful act of seizing control of a vehicle while in transit.

lexUnit.name: theft.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or crime of stealing

lexUnit.name: burglary.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: illegal entry into a building with intent to commit a crime such as theft

lexUnit.name: robbery.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of taking away personal property from a person by violence or by threat of violence that causes fear.

lexUnit.name: conspiracy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a secret plan by a group to do something unlawful or harmful.

lexUnit.name: larceny.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: theft of personal property

lexUnit.name: copyright infringement.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the unauthorized use of copyrighted matieral.

lexUnit.name: negligence.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: breach of a duty of care which results in damage.

lexUnit.name: possession.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the criminal act of possessing an illegal item or items

lexUnit.name: felony.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a crime, typically one involving violence, regarded in the US and other judicial systems (and formerly in the UK) as more serious than a misdemeanour.

lexUnit.name: sexual harassment.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: he repeated making of unwanted sexual advances or obscene remarks to a person, especially in a workplace.

lexUnit.name: treason.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the crime of betraying one's country, especially by attempting to kill or overthrow the sovereign or government.

lexUnit.name: battery.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the infliction of unlawful personal violence on another person, even where the contact does no physical harm.

lexUnit.name: kidnapping.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the crime of abducting someone and holding them captive

lexUnit.name: fraud.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: wrongful or criminal deception intended to result in financial or personal gain

lexUnit.name: indecent assault.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: intentional offensive sexual content made without consent of the victim and without intention to rape.

lexUnit.name: sexual assault.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: non-consentual sexual contact inflicted upon a person unable to give consent, or who trusts the assailant.

lexUnit.name: child abuse.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: treat a child with cruelty or violence

lexUnit.name: homicide.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: murder.

lexUnit.name: arson.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the criminal act of deliberately setting fire to property.

lexUnit.name: rape.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the crime of forcing another to have sexual intercourse without their consent
